text: <!here> - We are releasing a couple new features to the new Design Manager and are looking for alpha testers. The two new features are, 1. Allowing users to edit legacy Custom Modules without upgrading in the new Design Manager, 2. Relaxed validation (most notably HubL functions `include`, `import`, and `get_public_template_url`) to make your development easier. If this sounds like something you want to use before the larger release please fill out this form and we will release these alpha features to you: <https://goo.gl/forms/4XIz0duDmbK3bI2k2>
regarding #1: does it automatically “upgrade” them basically by auto setting their module type and since there is relaxed validation, those modules should automatically just be compatible?
No, the modules remain legacy modules, they’re just editable in the new design manager but don’t have access to any of the new module framework features.
2. relaxed validation of hubl in modules please!
If im using a a choice field in a CM how would i grab just the value for an IF statement? isnt it `{% if module.choice_field = 'value' %} something {%endif%}`
nvrmnd, forgot it was `==` for equals
nothing better than writing something out to find the answer
looks like someone accidentally pushed something live that wasn’t meant to go live <https://spin.d.pr/PMEORu+>
it’d be nice to have that hubl reference pane back
